title: Trump Tells Bondi to Seek Release of Epstein Grand Jury Testimony
summary: The attorney general plans to ask a court to release the papers. But even if the request succeeds, it would fall far short of critics’ demands to release all investigative materials.

title: House Republicans Dangle Possible Vote on Epstein Files, After Voter Backlash
summary: The House Rules Committee laid the groundwork for an eventual vote to call for release of the Epstein files, reflecting Republican uneasiness with the president’s refusal to divulge information from the investigation.

title: A Timeline of What We Know About Trump and Epstein
summary: Donald Trump was friendly for at least 15 years with Jeffrey Epstein, the multimillionaire financier and convicted sex offender who died in prison in 2019.

title: Congress Approves Trump Clawback of Foreign Aid and Funds for NPR and PBS Stations
summary: President Trump’s request to claw back $9 billion in congressionally approved spending passed despite objections from Republicans who said it abdicated the legislative branch’s power of the purse.

title: Republicans in Congress Fret Over Handing Trump Spending Power, Then Vote to Do It
summary: In voting for President Trump’s cancellation of $9 billion in spending they had already approved, Republicans in Congress showed they were willing to cede their power of the purse.

title: ‘Late Show With Stephen Colbert’ Is Being Canceled by CBS
summary: The show will end in May, the network said, calling it “a purely financial decision.”

title: Fans React to Colbert ‘Late Show’ Cancellation With Puzzlement and Anger
summary: Many questioned the timing of and motivation for the announcement, noting that Mr. Colbert hosted the most-watched show in late night television.

title: In the Trump Administration, Watchdogs Are Watching Their Backs
summary: The president has fired or demoted over 20 inspectors general since he took office. Employees say they are demoralized and reluctant to pursue investigations that could prompt political blowback.

title: Justice Dept. Asks California Sheriffs for Names of Undocumented Inmates
summary: An A.C.L.U. lawyer said it was possible that any sheriff who complied with the request could be in violation of California’s so-called sanctuary state law.

title: Trump’s Plan to Reopen Alcatraz Appears to Move Forward With Officials’ Visit
summary: Attorney General Pam Bondi and Interior Secretary Doug Burgum visited the site on Thursday to study whether reopening it as a federal prison could work.

title: Trump Diagnosed With Chronic Venous Insufficiency After Leg Swelling. What Is It?
summary: The condition, which can cause swelling and pain, is common among older adults.

title: Only 5 Fingers Playing Piano, but the Sound of So Many Hands
summary: Nicholas McCarthy overcame rejection to make a professional career playing the surprisingly vast repertoire for left-hand piano.

title: Top Fed Official Backs July Rate Cut as Trump Ramps Up Pressure
summary: Christopher Waller, a potential contender to be the next chair of the central bank, said the Federal Reserve should not wait for the labor market to weaken to reduce interest rates.

title: White House Seeks to Inspect Fed Renovation in Bid to Pressure Powell
summary: Russell T. Vought, the head of the Office of Management and Budget, said he and other administration officials wanted access to the Fed’s building in Washington.

title: Before Trump, Indonesia Had Another Trade Headache: China
summary: Long before President Trump wielded tariffs as a weapon to punish Indonesia, the country was fighting back a flood of cheap Chinese goods.

title: Crypto Industry Reaches Milestone With Passage of Genius Act
summary: After a week of squabbling in Washington, the cryptocurrency industry secured one of its primary legislative objectives and made progress toward a second one.

title: What to Know About the Three Crypto Regulation Bills in Congress
summary: The House this week took up a trio of bills that would establish a federal framework for regulating the cryptocurrency industry. One of the measures cleared Congress and is on its way to enactment.

title: Columbia and White House Enter Final Stage of Talks to End Standoff
summary: A deal to resolve allegations that the university failed to protect Jewish students from harassment is expected to include a fine of about $200 million.

title: Fired D.E.I. Administrator Rachel Dawson Sues the University of Michigan
summary: In her lawsuit, Rachel Dawson denies making antisemitic remarks and accuses the school of racial bias in its investigation and decision-making.

title: Iran’s Fordo Nuclear Site Was Badly Damaged by U.S. Strikes, New Assessment Finds
summary: A clearer picture begins to emerge of what the Israeli and U.S. attacks on Iran’s nuclear sites achieved.

title: The Cost of Trump’s Surrender to China
summary: China has been displaying intellectual and innovative vitality for decades and the United States has scarcely mobilized.

title: Is ‘Toxic Empathy’ Pulling Christians to the Left?
summary: How Allie Beth Stuckey is holding the line on the right.

title: Army Special Operations Warns Retired Members of Terror Threat
summary: The alert, issued to retired service members who served in Iraq or Syria and live in Florida, did not specify what kind of threat or which terrorist group was involved.

title: Musk Clears Final Hurdles for Tesla and Starlink in India
summary: In the first tangible inroads Elon Musk has sought for years in India, Starlink passed a final regulatory hurdle and Tesla opened its first India store.

title: Beware of ‘Swiper,’ a Fox at Grand Teton Park With a Penchant for Footwear
summary: One or more foxes have stolen at least 32 shoes, according to park officials, who warned campers to guard their belongings.

title: 5 Charged in U.C. Berkeley Professor’s Killing in Greece, Including His Ex-Wife
summary: Przemyslaw Jeziorski, who taught quantitative marketing at the Haas School of Business, was shot several times on July 4 outside Athens, the authorities said.
